intro: Paraboea siamensis, commonly known as the Siam paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and appear in clusters. It is often found in tropical forests, thriving in humid and shaded environments.
